result.execSummary:
The defendant Fredrick S Pickett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Fredrick S Pickett was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Fredrick S Pickett is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Fredrick S Pickett was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Fredrick S Pickett was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Bail applied. Fines and costs are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 50% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant must register as a sex offender.
Defendant must submit DNA sample.
Pay supervision fees.
No contact with B.Y or J.Y.
No contact with any females under age of 21 without approval of the agent.

Personal service notice dated 09/14/2017 was not provided to Attorney Russell J.A. Jones as attorney is required to opt in under Wis. Stats. 801.18(3)(a)1 and 801.18(5)(e).
Motion hearing on January 4, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Fredrick S Pickett in court with attorney Steven Zaleski.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel addresses motion to vacate order for sex offender registration. State requests court order the evaluation and to not make decision today. No objection by counsel. Court will order an evaluation and report be completed. Parties to discuss and file a proposed order regarding who will conduct evaluation. Counsel addresses motion for resentencing citing that age was not appropriately expressed/considered and the fact that defendant had never been to prison. Discussion regarding said motion. Response by State. Court believes the court considered the defendant's age at time of sentencing. Court makes findings regarding sending defendant to prison. Court denies motion for resentencing.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 4, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Count 1: Guilty
Sentencing hearing on November 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Fredrick S Pickett in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Trial to proceed today for one day. State addresses motion. Counsel responds to motion. Court grants State's Motion in Limine. Court calls jurors into court.
9:05 am/Jurors report and given oath. Court welcomes jury.
9:06 am/Voir dire by Court.
9:25 am/Voir dire by Attorney Patti Wabitsch.
9:47 am/Voir dire by Attorney Russell Jones.
9:59 am/Counsel striking of jury.
10:04 am/12 jurors called to hear case. All other jurors thanked and excused.
10:06 am/Jury given oath to try case.
10:07 am/Court preliminary instructions to jury.
10:13 am/Jury excused. 
10:14 am/Court addresses previous request. Witnesses will be sequestered, victim may remain in courtroom. Court readdresses ruling on motion in limine.
10:16 am/Court and counsel on recess.
10:30 am/Case recalled. Jury called to courtroom.
10:34 am/Opening statement by Attorney Wabitsch.
10:38 am/Opening statement by Attorney Jones.
10:41 am/Witness R.Y. sworn and testifies.
11:20 am/Witness J.Y. sworn and testifies.
11:32 am/Witness T.C. sworn and testifies.
11:38 am/State requests short break. Court in recess.
11:50 am/Jury called to courtroom.
11:51 am/Officer Guttmann sworn and testifies.
11:57 am/State rests.
11:58 am/Jurors excused for lunch.
12:00 pm/Court and counsel in recess.
1:32 pm/Case recalled. Counsel moves to dismiss. State argues motion. Court denies motion to dismiss. Defendant elects not to testify. Court examines defendant and reviews rights not to testify. Court breaks to review jury instructions.
1:49 pm/Case recalled. Defendant now elects to testify. Court examines defendant. 
1:56 pm/Jury called into courtroom.
1:57 pm/Defendant Fredrick Pickett sworn and testifies.
2:11 pm/Defense rests.
2:13 pm/Court delivers Jury Instructions to the jurors.
2:25 pm/Closing statement by Attorney Wabitsch.
2:31 pm/Closing statement by Attorney Jones.
2:40 pm/Rebuttal by Attorney Wabitsch.
2:46 pm/Court further instructs the jury.
2:50 pm/Bailiff sworn.
2:51 pm/Jury leaves for deliberation.
7:19 pm/Case recalled with same appearances. Court was notified jury has reached a verdict. Jury called into courtroom.
7:22 pm/Verdicts read.
7:25 pm/Jury polled at the request of defense. 
7:26 pm/Jurors thanked and excused.
7:26 pm/State requests judgment on two verdicts and requests remand. Counsel requests acquittal on counts 3 and 4. Court enters judgment on all four counts. Defendant is remanded. Sentencing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 9:30 am.

Defendant Frederick S Pickett appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel waives reading & advises the defendant qualifies for public defender representation, but will be retaining private counsel.  Court finds probable cause.  State requesting $3000 cash bail w/conditions.
